Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different types of habitats, such as a forest, garden, playground, pond, stream, or lake.
The student can include various plants and animals in each habitat, like trees, grasses, flowers, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can observe and accurately represent differences in plant and animal life between land habitats and water habitats.
The student can show patterns of diversity by comparing the number and types of living things in different habitats.
The student can label and organize their drawing to clearly display the observations made about each habitat.
